text:
4 months later and the comment section aged so poorly like an already spoiled milk.

"The hype was lost after 7 years", "I won't buy", "Who is even excited for this?" etc.

Meanwhile the game broke every store when it came out and was nominated for a lot of stuff in Game Awards and people love it (besides casuals who have no idea how to enjoy a hard game).
author: @ybaBeulB

text: ‚ÄúHas been canceled‚Äù I‚Äôm sure that‚Äôs what many thought
author: @TheAsperator

text:
Great for anyone excited for this but im just tired of any game dev or company or studio or whatever announce something WAY ahead of their release.

Why not just...you know...announce it when youre at least half way through on the development? I understand building up hype and im not suggesting only announcing a month before release or whatever. Hype have like a peak point it doesnt just grow overtime with no limit. At some point people stopped waiting. And im one of them

This applies to GTA 6 and Elder Scroll 6 (this one is announced back in the E3 days üòÇ man i feel old) as well.


edit: anyway off topic but I have 0 hype for Elder Scroll 6 at this point. look at the last 2 big games they did Fallout 76 and Starfield. and the reason Oblivion remaster is good is because‚Ä¶well‚Ä¶its a skin attached to an already good game.

text: it's releasing september 4th my dude what are you on about? They haven't said anything for 6 years only to communicate on it 2 weeks before it releases. So again let me ask this blunty: What the actual fuck are you about?
author: @oussamaokbi

text:
‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã¬†@oussamaokbi¬† im talking about them releasing a trailer on E3 2019. Thats my problem. If youre fine waiting 6 years after trailer then good for you. They dont just release a cinematic or anything THEY DID A GAMEPLAY TRAILER 6 YEARS AGO.

I KNOW THERES A REASON for the long wait. I do know how hard game development is and how shorthanded they are. But...i just dont like it when something is announced too early. My ideal is 3 or 4 years MAX. And beyond that my hype is just...gone man i dont know what to tell you.

ONCE AGAIN my problem isnt that the development is too long. My problem is they release the trailer too early. I rather think Hollow Knight is a standalone game, NOT KNOWING theyre working silently in the background a DLC or a sequel. and then 6 years later BAM a Silksong trailer reveal and its releasing in 2 weeks.
author: @TheKnightCrafter123

text:
‚Äã¬†@oussamaokbi¬† i also forgot to mention that in 2022 XBOX official said that Silksong will be playable within a year

Look how that turned out.
author: @TheKnightCrafter123

text:
silksong was supposed to be just a DLC at first. They could've released it in a year if they really wanted to. 

why is it a bad thing that it took 7? the only problem I have with team cherry is lack of communication but a small team taking years to make a great game is normal. These kinds of expectations is what should be put on AAA studios
